Part of the two restaurants of the hotel, Shang Palace is the only starred chinese restaurant in France. Le Bar Botaniste, friendly and intimate, is the perfect Parisian meeting place. Four historical reception rooms welcome the most prestigious events and wedding. Finally, CHI, The Spa, with its 15-meter pool bathed in natural daylight , is an invitation to relaxation and serenity. Numerous features make Shangri-La Paris one of the most elegant addresses in the French.

Name: Ellsworth
Description: Romantic and cozy gastronomical restaurant and wine bar featuring a limited seasonal menu sourced from small producers and its own vegetable garden, complemented by a robust wine list featuring independent producers and a strong selection of natural wines. Accommodating of most dietary restrictions. Separate dining room and bar menus.

Name: Pierre Sang on Gambey
Description: Two years after « Pierre Sang in Oberkampf », Chef Pierre Sang opened his second restaurant « Pierre Sang on Gambey » only a few steps away. With an intimate, chic and calm decor, high wooden tables and a warm atmosphere, customers will be struck by the friendliness and the love of sharing that characterizes Pierre Sang so well. The open kitchen welcomes everyone to witness the dishes simmering and sizzling in the kitchen. The wine is ready to meet your utmost expectations. From grand cru wines to more modest appellations and excellent natural and organic wines, the wine list is full of treasures for both casual wine novices to serious wine advocates. In 2021, the restaurant on Gambey takes a new direction by moving from 6 to 8 rue Gambey to offer a warmer setting to its customers.

Name: La Factory Burger
Description: A good place for enjoy a good home made burger in paris downtown (châtelet Les Halles) for a good moment anytime in a day! And it ll be a pleasure to share our passions for craft Beers from France And all around the world!

Name: Caffe Stern
Description: “A historical French landmark with the flavors of Italy” Caffè Stern, located in the heart of Paris inside the Passage des Panoramas, is the brainchild of the Alajmo brothers and Gianni Frasi, a fourth-generation coffee roaster from Verona. Housed inside a landmark letterpress shop, Caffè Stern was brought back to life thanks to designer Philippe Starck. Open all day, visitors can stop by for an olive oil brioche in the morning and return later in the day for Venetian-style “cicchetti” like baccalà mantecato (whipped stockfish) with fried polenta squares. The lunch and dinner menu features Italian classics revisited by Max Alajmo like spaghetti alla Carbonara or a “cappuccino” made with potato puree and Bolognese meat ragu.

Name: Uma Nota
Description: Unpretentious, open-minded and lively, Uma Nota’s distinctive character is reflected in its atmosphere, street food, authentic drinks and design. Combining Japanese techniques with fresh Brazilian ingredients, whether you like it raw, skewered or to be shared, every item on the menu is carefully balanced to reflect Sao Paulo’s favourite flavours.

Name: Elmer
Description: Modern French cuisine. Fish / Meat slowly cooked on our "rotissoire" or barbecue. Fresh and organic products. Wine list available..

Name: Dans Le Noir ?
Description: More than a restaurant, Dans le Noir ? is an international brand with a unique concept where patrons dine in complete darkness, guided and served by amazing and unexpected staff. An original experience that has intrigued and awakened the minds of millions of people for more than 18 years. Your senses are awakened and invite you to an unforgettable culinary journey! Discover now this unique sensory, social and human experience in all our venues around the world: London, Paris, Madrid, Barcelona, Saint Petersburg, Auckland, Melbourne, Marrakech, Nantes, Bordeaux.

Name: L'officine Paris
Description: Just a stone's throw from Place de la République, at the Oberkampf metro station, L'Officine Paris is a unique Restaurant and Wine Bar built in the heart of an original 1900 Parisian pharmacy. With dishes that are 100% fresh and homemade, L'Officine offers a menu that changes daily, as well as a selection of over 150 wines, all available by the bottle or glass. Our whole concept is based on exchanging ideas and preferences with you so you can discover new wines!

Name: Le Marmiton de Lutece
Description: Traditional French restaurant in the heart of Paris. In an exceptional atmosphere in addition to our meats and fish we serve Fondues, Raclettes, Pierrades, Mont d'or, Tartiflette. If you want to spend an unforgettable evening, you just have to come and visit our restaurant

Name: Brasserie Les Deux Palais
Description: In the heart of historic Paris, on the Ile de la Cité, between Notre-Dame, the Sainte-Chapelle and the Conciergerie, and facing the Court House,the brasserie Les Deux Palais is a special place that invites you on a historical, cultural and culinary journey. The journey begins with the atmosphere of a place with a neat and signed decoration of the 19th century, in a Belle Epoque style with its columns holding a high ceiling to let in the light. Mirrors and brass railings offer the discreet luster of an unostentatious shine. It is in this sumptuous decor that our waiters welcome you with the hospitality due to the guests who honour us with their visit. Then the journey continues in the plate where we offer you dishes in the pure French culinary tradition. Finally, adventure into the best terroirs of France by exploring a carefully selected wine list. The brasserie Les Deux Palais is an immersion into the French art of living offered to all

Name: Le Bouclard
Description: Michel has reenacted an old Parisian restaurant where under the supervision of Rosalie he elaborates some of the best French traditional dishes such as: crayfish tails gratine with Macon blanc-Terrine of foie gras served with tiny potatoes brushed with truffle olive oil, fresh shives and flower salt from “guerande”- Veal breast with thyme, slowly braised 48 hours at °F145 - Heart of veal sweetbread Alexander style. Icing on the cake, is the home made Pastrami noted 4 stars by American patrons of the restaurant. The \he Man\pieces of meat are carved in front of the patrons. Michel signs all his recepies inherited or inspired by his forbears, some of them being dishes requiring lots of tender loving care.

Name: Restaurant la Ville de Provins Paris
Description: Situated nearby Gare de l'Est Station , the Brasserie and Restaurant La Ville de Provins welcomes you every day to taste good quality traditional brasserie dishes or simply to have a drink while waiting for your train, and this throughout the day. Dating of the beginning of the century, you will be seduced by its typical decoration and its moderate prices, as well as by his sunny terrace. For more information visit our Facebook page!

Name: Buddha-Bar
Description: Reated thanks to the visionary imagination of Raymond Visan, owner of the famous Barfly in Paris, this restaurant-bar-lounge, located on the ultra-chic Faubourg St Honoré, rapidly became a a must-see and be-seen in the French capital. With its cinema-style décor, covering a 1,000 square meter surface area, the Buddha-Bar boasts majestic proportions, with three levels built around a monumental Buddha, over 4 meters high. Alcove lounges wind around the mezzanine and its bar sculpted in the form of a dragon with red scales and green jade, offering strategically cozy spots, where you may enjoy a privileged moment of relaxation by candlelight, unobserved by others. Gigantic arabesque chandeliers in red velvet embroidered with golden thread are beautifully suspended above the restaurant with its round tables and warm, discreet red lounge, for a fully enjoyable dining experience. The Pacific Rim menu with Pan-Asian, Californian and European influences, combines fresh products, subtle flavors and spices from around the world, based on a concept of sharing meals. The warm and pleasant Pacific atmosphere and the restaurant's attentive and friendly waiting staff help create a highly relaxing ambiance, which is subtly enhanced by the music carefully selected by the resident DJs. Here, you are suspended in time and the journey is just beginning.... Breathe in deeply....You are at the Buddha-Bar.

Name: Phở Bánh Cuốn 14
Description: House specialties: Pho soup served with chicken or beef, spring rolls with pork or chicken, ravioli and rice pancakes ...

Name: Les Noces de Jeannette
Description: Les Noces de Jeannette is a restaurant with more than a century of history behind it. Inside, the décor evokes the story of Opéra Comique and Paris's iconic Grands Boulevards. With its five rooms, Les Noces de Jeannette can host business lunches, romantic meals for two or family dinners, as well as private, family and professional events. The restaurant offers traditional French cuisine made with local products and an impressive selection of wines from independent winemakers.

Name: Astair
Description: This is the revival of the French Bistrot. We've designed a restaurant that wants to emphasize the fact that Paris is still a moveable feast. Why not go out in a suit, or in an evening dress, and have escargots at the bar? What about a cocktail, music, and cuisses de grenouilles ? Come and celebrate with us our idea of France and French food. We've created a typical French menu with extreme quality goals. Have a seat at our table!

Name: Sous les Cerisiers
Description: Dear customers, We hope that one day, we will have the pleasure of welcoming you to our home, in our restaurant Sous les Cerisiers in Paris.

Name: Le New York
Description: French brasserie with a terrace with a beautiful view on the Eiffel Tower. A young and attentive service with an authentic and homemade french cuisine are the values of the New York. We will be happy to welcome you very soon !

Name: Restaurant Gastronomique Louis
Description: Gourmet restaurant in the Michelin Guide 15/20 Gault et Millau "Through this menu it is a bit of my identity that I invite you to discover, my roots, Brittany, my travels, a look at the ocean, my feet on earth and inspiration in search of new horizons "Chef Stéphane Pitré

Name: Restaurant La Lozère
Description: Be seduced by the charm of our authenticity If you are in search of a friendly atmosphere, the Restaurant "La Lozère " invites you , from Tuesday to Saturday for lunch and dinner , to cheap tourist escape in Lozère. To be certain to welcome you in pleasant and comfortable conditions we recommend you to book by phone.

Name: La Caspita
Description: A modern and warm Italian restaurant in the heart of Paris, in wich you can have a taste of homemade dishes that respects traditional culinary traditions and prepared with fresh ingredients.

Name: Pavyllon
Description: The PavYllon, at the Pavillon Ledoyen, is a restaurant imagined by chef Yannick Alleno and designed by Chahan Minassian. Settle in for a dining experience at the counter featuring the cuisine of chef Thomas Ruiz. Inspired by Japanese and Italian cuisine combined with French technique, courses change to reflects product in season.

Name: Braisenville
Description: A casual gourmet restaurant: creative seasonal cuisine in a friendly atmosphere, where lively flavours are enhanced over charcoal embers - a pioneering technique in Paris. The best produce and wines, also served ’au naturel’. At dinner: raciones from €6 to €14 about or Tasting menu at €49 (with wine pairings at €79). At lunch: menus such as starter + main course + dessert at €22, or Carte Blanche menu at €35. Our style of cuisine invites the diner to a shared experience, a journey and an emotional feast. Every week we meet with producers as passionate as ourselves, to harvest the best seasonal produce from the Ile de France region and elsewhere. Every day, we use these ingredients to elaborate our menu with love, imagination and precision. This same quest for real ‘savoir-faire’ is evident in our selection of wines, spirits, coffee and tea: paired, or not, with each ración, natural, biodynamic and truly organic food and drink pairings.

Name: Gegeor
Description: GEGEOR is a Wine Cellar and a Restaurant in the same time. Wine cellar : the primary profession of the establishment is to advise and sell wine. 250 references of wines and spirits, only wines of independent wine maker and around 50% of organic, biodynamic or natural wines. Restaurant: family dishes at most cooked on site, composed of ingredients from the "terroir". Here the cooking is made to put the wine in value.

Name: Bistro Saint Dominique
Description: Near the Eiffel Tour, open everyday, non stop service with love. Breakfast, lunch and diner. Homemade food. The Bistro Saint-Dominique, 131 of the bustling street of the same name, in the heart of the 7th in Paris, re-opens its doors after a total makeover in the room as well as in the plate. Everything from floor to ceiling has been redesigned and renovated keeping of course the bistro spirit that has always reigned there. Chef Alexandre Linsolas has been entrusted with the exciting task of creating a whole new gastronomic offer. Breakfast, lunch, aperitif, snacks or dinner, he has completely redesigned the map. The latter, shorter, offers 8 starters, 8 dishes and 8 desserts. Each day a dish of the day is honored, and the chef makes a point of honor to use only seasonal products, if possible organic and labeled from local producers; Proximity being one of his spearheads. This new card is greedy, relaxed and above all more readable. His creations are simply relevant and Parisian.

Name: Le Grand Cafe Capucines
Description: Created at the inauguration of the Opera Garnier in 1875, the Grand Café Capucines quickly became a place not to be missed on the Grands Boulevards. Located in the 9th arrondissement, this Parisian brasserie is a witness and actor of the incessant cultural activity of the Boulevard des Capucines. Open every day from 7am to 1am, this restaurant revisits the traditional dishes that make the reputation of French gastronomy. The Chef offers a cuisine that harmoniously blends flavors and always respects the seasonality of the products. Oysters, lobster à la Parisienne and seafood platters can be enjoyed, in continuous service, with colleagues, family or friends, for an after-show dinner, a romantic dinner... or for a lunch on the terrace !

Name: Le Campanella
Description: Le Campanella is a Typical French Brasserie nearby the Eiffel Tower Area. You will discover and enjoy to start with our Onion Soup, French duck foie gras or our typical frog legs or amazing Snails... You will continue your Odissey with our Beef Stew "Bourguignon", our Royal Cassoulet, our French duck confit or many others good dishes. And for gourmets you will be able to taste our "Tarte Tatin" (upside-down apple pie and fresh cream, or our "Crème Brulée" (caramelised custard cream), or our "Eclair Géant Très Chocolat" (giant eclair so chocolate)...And because this is France and this is Paris, good food always comes with good wines. You will discover treasures in our cave such as Château Lynch-Bages, Château Léoville Barton, Châteauneuf-du-Pape, Côte-Rôtie, Clos des Mouches, Meursault...and so many others (be aware stocks are not unlimited and may varie...). Please remember that we would be more than happy to welcome you at Le Campanella.

Name: Le Confidentiel
Description: Upscale French restaurant HALAL kind located in the prestigious golden triangle of Paris, fields axis Elysées, Avenue Montaigne, François 1st Street, The Confidential welcomes you in a cozy lounge setting for a romantic meal, a group, or for a meal of business leader Rudy Suzan will satisfy you thanks to its past experience in the hotel Costes, Durand Smith, the Villa ....

Name: Perruche
Description: A cosy rooftop with the best panoramic view of Paris. A indoor and outdoor casual fine dining restaurant Home made French Food Open 9:35am until 2am ! Dj Every Thursday Night Pianist Every Friday Night

Name: Le Clarence
Description: In the centre of the Parisian Golden Triangle, nestled within a superb 19th century private mansion, the gastronomic restaurant Le Clarence, awarded two stars by the Michelin Guide since 2017, offers an instinctive and vibrantly modern style of cuisine. At Le Clarence, there is no set menu, but rather a variety of dishes based on exceptional and seasonal products. The land-sea associations, dear to the chef, are enhanced during each “sequence” of the meal by a myriad of satellite plates with marked flavours. This culinary audacity is refined by the charm of French-style service for a timeless interlude. In the restaurant's cellar, prestigious wines and those of extremely limited production, stand happily side by side, with the sommeliers creating pairings that complement the chef's cuisine. On the third floor of the mansion, three private reception rooms are available to host a variety of events, ranging from business lunches and seminars to press events and private dinners.

Name: L'Empreinte
Description: The EMPREINTE exists since October 2016, we have been on the Michelin guide for 4 years, thanks to our customers our restaurant has become a must in Paris 14th. The two partners Jean François (in the dining room) and Noel (chef in the kitchen) loved to cook only with fresh products, with recipes from our grandparents. We loved to preserve the taste and authenticity of French cooking. Long live the good cooking of our beautiful FRANCE. The pleasure of seeing you.

Name: Le Pre Catelan
Description: Located in the heart of the famous Bois de Boulogne, this treasure of French cuisine received 3 stars in the Michelin Guide.

Name: Himalaya Restaurant
Description: Himalaya Restuarant Gaite in the heart of Paris traditional Indian Pakistani gastronomy. We have the authentic taste of spices and curry. Quality service of Indian and Pakistani cuisine since 1983 in Paris. We offer : - Delivery at home, office - Reservation event (Birthday, Wedding dinner, Business lunch, Meetings) - Home delivery (Paris 05, Paris 06, Paris 07, Paris 13, Paris 14, Paris 15)

Name: Le Ballon des Ternes
Description: Near Porte Maillot and the Palais des Congres convention center, the Ballon des Ternes is a stylish brasserie known for its French cuisine and variety of seafood. Its offshoot restaurant, the Ballon et Coquillages, invites you to enjoy shellfish seated around a circular bar. The entrance opens onto a large zinc counter while the broad banquettes add a warm touch. Both private rooms upstairs feature the same Art Deco spirit, with chandeliers and stained glass, giving an authentic "Belle Epoque" atmosphere. Efficient service and Parisian charm make the Ballon des Ternes restaurant perfect for both business lunches and romantic dinners. In summer, you can enjoy the many house specialties out in the sun.

Name: Restaurant Diep
Description: Established in 1985 by the Diep family , the restaurant bearing the same name and located just off the most beautiful avenue in the world has succeeded over the years in carving out a great reputation for itself in the parisian restaurant scene. Known for the refinement and subtlety of its dishes, diep offers you a cultured and elegant setting, enhanced by objets d'art, wood panelling and frescos imported directly from asia. diep restaurant The Diep restaurant specialises in a combination of chinese and thai cuisine executed with finesse and delicacy. A wealth of eastern flavours await your palate, and you can choose between the subtleties of chinese cooking on the one hand and the spicier aromatics of thai cuisine on the other. Along with our established clientele, you are invited to appreciate the richness of the flavours offered by our authentic cuisine, which, thanks to our home delivery service, you can also savour in the comfort of your own home.

Name: Chez Pitou
Description: home-made cooking, worked with care, fresh products selected for their seasonality and a selection of wines at reasonable price in agreement with the dishes. A warm and friendly place, where to please yourself is the most important. Cooked dishes with passion and a friendly atmosphere to awaken your taste buds. See you soon in Montmartre !

Name: Safran
Description: Restaurant SAFRAN an innovative, fresh approach to Indian cuisine, Restaurant SAFRAN offers a relaxed, contemporary atmosphere in which to enjoy the extraordinary, vibrant Pan-Asian cuisine. In over a decade of service, the restaurant has sought to redefine Indian food, decor and service. Restaurant SAFRAN elaborate and extensive menu incorporates the best of Indian, Pakistani and Banglades cuisine with specialities and influences from all over the Asia, often, with a European twist. Rare, unusual meats feature on the menu and Cyrus's. Speciality Menu changes fortnightly to take advantage of the best of French seasons have to offer. All dishes use only the freshest of ingredients, cooked with natural herbs and Cyrus's own spice blends. Restaurant SAFRAN is dedicated to promoting environmental awareness and won two 'Environmental Best Practice' Executive Chefs and Experienced Hospitality with full Audio Video inside our restaurant. Restaurant SAFRAN - Speciality of Traditional and Innovative Indian Cuisine.

Name: Restaurant Caillebotte
Description: Located in the heart of Paris, next to "rue des Martyrs", Caillebotte restaurant offers a fine neo bistrot cuisine in a modern scandinavian atmosphere

Name: La Poule Au Pot
Description: The third owners - since June 2018 - of the restaurant La Poule au Pot, a Parisian institution that has been open for more than 80 years, Élodie and Jean-François Piège have imagined a menu that is part of France's culinary heritage through the generosity of bourgeois cuisine - emblematic of French savoir-vivre from the 19th century until the 1950s - which is reflected in these dishes. A convivial state of mind which is reflected in the place, refreshed, but left, as one of the characteristics of its dishes, "in its juice", typical of the 30s.

Name: Angelina
Description: The Rue de Rivoli tea room is available by phone every day from 9am to 5pm.

Name: Le Coin
Description: Superb little French bistro, simple family-run establishment with outstanding food and great value! Home-made traditional French cuisine.

Name: Gusto Italia 218
Description: Gusto Italia makes you discovering local flavours from italian "cuisine" with fresh products, bio pizzas and home specialities. The restaurant have a typical glamourous ambiance, which makes you traveling in the heart of Milan. Come & visit us !

Name: La Bourse et La Vie
Description: La Bourse et La Vie is a traditional "Bistrot du Quartier" conveniently located between the Palais Royal and the Bourse de Paris in Paris' 2e arrondissement. The restaurant offers guests the epitome of French gourmandise - the highest quality ingredients, excellence in the kitchen, abundance, generosity, and of course, a respect for tradition.

Name: Suan Thai
Description: SAWADEE KHRAP Traditionnal Thai food. Chef MALEERAT Jantha is from Isan , north east thailand. Cuisine Isan is the most balanced food in thailand. we use quality ingredients and fresh products. Chef offer a large vegan plates. KAPUNKHAP

Name: Chez Papa Bastille
Description: Chez Papa Paris 10 is the first institution created by "Papa" there 20 years, just in front of the station subway Louis Blanc. Come and discover the soul and authenticity of the restaurant Chez Papa, a unique atmosphere where it is not uncommon to see "DAD" near the counter to greet you with a firm handshake and manly. Our room team is at your disposal in French, English or Occitan and cooking, chef of Chez Papa Paris 10, his brigade, its pans, saucepans and kettles sing in unison with the colors of the Southwest. You can taste the traditional recipes of "DAD" played to perfection: the Auvergne duck, Achua etc ... Do not hesitate to ask us for our best table and all of our staff will be happy you have a pleasant gourmet moment: Eye to the taste buds, your senses will be delighted and your sharp appetite

Name: Restaurant Indonesia
Description: The first indonesian restaurant in Paris, since 1982. We provide dine in and take away. In 6th district of Paris.

Name: Le Récamier
Description: Far from the hustle and bustle of Paris, you can still sense the spirit of Madame Récamier in Saint-Germain-des-Prés. Juliette Récamier was an iconic woman of letters, described by writer and critic Sainte-Beuve as a "gentle genius". Famed across Europe for her beauty and intelligence, she was one of the most admired women of her time. Leading figures from the political, intellectual, and artistic worlds flocked to her salon, which was celebrated for its lively discussion and debate. Madame Récamier brought a new spirit to her times, expressed in her refined and delicate touch. Today, her spirit is still alive, accentuating the cuisine of our globally renowned chef Gérard Idoux and inspiring the conversation of literary, cultural, and political figures who dine here. The elegance of Madame Récamier's salon lives on.

Name: Brasserie Floderer
Description: Come through the arches of this little cobbled walkway, nestled in the heart of the 10th arrondissement in Paris, a stone's throw from the Gare de l'Est, and open your eyes and prepare your taste buds...! In an authentic setting dating from the 19th century, Brasserie FLODERER plunges you into the heart of Alsace and its gastronomy. Find all the conviviality of a great land over lunch or dinner.

Name: Pierre Sang
Description: In June 2012, Pierre Sang opened his first restaurant « Pierre Sang in Oberkampf » in the heart of the 11th arrondissement in Paris. This booming neighborhood received him warmly. His credo : total transparency. An open kitchen in the center of the room welcomes customers eager for culinary discoveries around the central counter. No menu ! The unique menus, which change every day for lunch and every month for dinner, are an avalanche of flavors and textures. French tradition blends with Korean techniques and influences. An alliance based on the cultural mix of the chef. Fresh seasonal products, from local artisans, are given pride of place. Passionate about oenology, Pierre Sang has a particular desire to offer 40 quality references. Great vintages, less precious bottles or natural wines, the palette is within everyone’s reach. He now offers a quick menu to enjoy on the go at lunchtime and a tapas formula to share with friends or family in the evening.

Name: Ratn
Description: Since more than forty years, the three generations of the Bhalla family immortalize the beautiful Indian culinary tradition in Paris and master the culinary art of Mughal cuisine at RATN ...

Name: L'Avant Comptoir
Description: ... No seat, no table but a preface to the greed, revenge of the aperitif, gastronomy vertically, a gy mnastique the hatch, buissonniers of wines and foods of aphorisms and euphoria ... -Emmanuel rubin, figaroscope.

Name: Arnaud Nicolas
Description: A la carte, and also to take away from a creative corner shop, Arnaud Nicolas cooks classics from the French charcuterie, in a refined way: deli meats preparations made of poultry and foie gras, sausages of Lyons, “terrine grand-mère”… Another credo of the craftsman: draw inspiration from pastry-making to bring a new twist and a creative look to his deli meats. Arnaud Nicolas’ restaurant is the spot of a butcher who watches back to the past for his values, sticks to the present to keep with the times and looks towards the future for quenching his thirst of innovation. A menu is also available with fishes and vegetables !

Name: Bistrot 31
Description: The Bistrot 31 welcomes you in a friendly atmosphere. The team is at your service and all our dishes are homemade, with love, to the rhythm of the seasons.

Name: Visconti
Description: Visconti restaurant in the heart of Paris’ Arc de Triomphe is so much a family-run Italian establishment that you will find members of the Franceschelli family everywhere, from the kitchen to the front of house and everywhere in between. Originally from the village of Capracotta in the Apennine hills, the family offers authentic, refined Italian cuisine du terroir using the freshest ingredients with cheeses, charcuterie and wines imported from the old country. Desserts are all made in Visconti’s own kitchen. The dining rooms are cosy and smart, with wooden floors, antique paintings, dark wood tables and comfortable upholstered chairs that invite you to linger. The service is thoughtful and the ambience full of Italian warm

Name: Villa Punjab Gastronomie Indienne
Description: Tel.01 42 67 58 99  Recommande par Figaro Scope

Name: L'Abreuvoir
Description: In a typically Parisian frame(executive), a young dynamic team serves our accustomed customers or the tourists come visit the Eiffel Tower on wooden tables varnished. A wide wine list is posted(shown) in wine shops in wall. The terrace is warmed and opened all year long noon(south) and evening. The cooking(kitchen) is realized on the spot by one cooked professionals from raw products and mainly French.

Name: Chez Francoise
Description: Chez Françoise is a French fine dining restaurant, created in 1949, located in central Paris, near les Invalides and the Eiffel tower. Chez Françoise is an ideal place to discover French gastronomy, with several rooms decorated in traditional French style and an affordable menu.

Name: Le petit Bouillon Pharamond
Description: Since 1832 the Pharamond is a unique place. The décor, today listed as en historical building, is an amazing mix of wood, painted mirrors and molten glass. The Chef will be pleased to let you taste his food, in between nostalgic winks and tasty new dishes. You may reserve one of five rooms (4 to 50 people) for your professional or private events. In addition, on a sunny day, you can enjoy the beautiful greenery and very quiet terrace.

Name: Le Restaurant Erh
Description: French-japanese cuisine by chef Ryuichi Utsumi inside the sake shop "La Maison du Saké" and above the largest whisky bar in France "the Golden Promise"

Name: Maxim's
Description: A historically ranked landmark, the Maxim's restaurant has become a symbolic place of Art Nouveau, French Gastronomy and also the most imperative meeting place for numerous international celebrities.

Name: Le Chalet Savoyard
Description: In a warm atmosphere in the heart of Paris in the 11th arrondissement, this stylish restaurant attracts all lovers of authentic Savoyard cuisine made with genuine local products.

Name: Le Coq & Fils - The Poultry House
Le Basilic
Description: beautiful French Brasserie in the Art Deco style , Traditional French cuisine, Amazing Green terrace ,with the view of spectacular basilica Holy clotilde built 1857 , class monument historique

Name: Loup
Description: LOUP offers quality dishes using fresh market produce, cooked minute ,home made,continuously. Kitchen is open from 8AM /1 AM, breakfasts,! starting 8 AM eggs bénédicte, avocado,guacamole,salmon gravlax,waffles, chocolat banana bread, carrot cake, cream cheese, croissant, pancakes, health detox, homemade cookies, granola,fruit salad. Bon Appetit !

Name: Buzkashi
Description: Only steps away from Place Clichy in Paris, is a pleasant family restaurant, typically afghan.Vous will be received warmly authentic decor and taste the specialties Afghanistan. You can choose to enjoy comfortably seated at a table or in a platform, sitting on cushions surrounded by Afghan carpets, an invitation to travel .... Of typical dishes of steamed rice (tchalow), to skewers of meat (kabob) and spices,Ashak (small dumplings with leeks with his meat with yogurt, Kaboli(lamb, brown rice with dried fruits and vegetables) and many other dishes to discover.

Name: Camélia
Description: Cuisine bistronomique parisienne chic, autour de produits de saison sourcés, dans une ambiance raffinée et contemporaine. En choisissant des ingrédients frais, provenant majoritairement de sources durables, les équipes du restaurant Camélia mettent à l’honneur les producteurs locaux et imaginent en collaboration avec le Chef Maxime Gilbert des plats inspirés des bistrots parisiens. Les arts de la table ont également été pensés pour mettre en avant le savoir-faire des artisans français. Poursuivez l’expérience en dégustant notre nouveau goûter et les délicieuses pâtisseries imaginées en collaboration avec le Chef Julien Dugourd. Magnifiquement décoré et donnant sur notre paisible jardin, le restaurant offre un cadre baigné de lumière. Pendant les beaux jours, les convives sont invités à profiter de notre superbe jardin verdoyant. Les tables en terrasse sont attribuées selon l’ordre d'arrivée.

Name: Bien Bien
Description: Hey, if you are looking for a quick break in Thailand while you staying in Paris, feel free to come and share a good time with us. We happen to cook tasty and traditional recipes, and as a family business, we also want to have a nice moment serving you. See you ^^

Name: Taj Mahal Paris
Description: "Taj Mahal Paris vous souhaite bon appétit ! Le restaurant Taj Mahal Paris, situé à quelque 300 mètres de la Tour Eiffel, vous invite à un voyage culinaire du côté de l´Inde. Le cadre est boisé et typiquement indien dans sa décoration. Au menu, le Chef compose avec ses épices des plats gourmands et savoureux qui enchanteront vos papilles expertes. À la carte, vous retrouverez les grands classiques de la cuisine Indienne : Samossa, Poulet Tikka, Raïta ou encore Briyanis. L´établissement dispose également d´une terrasse pour que vous puissiez vous délecter de vos mets à l´air libre. Et, pour vos événements festifs, l´établissement permet la privatisation du lieu."

Name: Didon
Description: Seasonal French cuisine with various dishes that can be shared and everything is cooked over the barbecue. All our wine references can be served also by the glass.

Name: Racines
Description: Racines is more than a restaurant; it's a celebration of everyday life. The culinary team sources the finest Italian and French produce, crafting dishes that tell the story of the seasons through intense and flavorful ingredients, a menu with real, honest, and robust flavors. The menu, inspired by the culinary traditions of Sardinia, Italy, and Paris, places the customer at the heart of the gastronomic experience. Guests at Racines are welcomed into an ambiance that is not only romantic and intimate but also infused with genuine warmth and authenticity.

Name: Kirane India
Description: Kirane India is an indian restaurant serving special indian dishes in a way that respect traditions in a trendy and cosy room just nearby Porte Maillot in Paris. We want to get rid of the usual entrée-main-dessert menu you could find everywhere by proposing a menu you would find in India : a mix of mains and sides you can mix and match according to your taste. Our goal is to make you travel to India through food, at Kirane India we want to show you how Indians really eat without the need to leave Paris.

Name: Bistrot Kinzo
Description: French and Japanese fusion. Fresh products and a menu that evolves with the seasons. The owner Edward Uchiyama was the Head Chef at the Intercontinental hotel Marceau, worked for Joel Robuchon and at the Four Seasons George V hotel. Come and experience a Journey to Japan and France with our 6 course Tasting menu and wine or sake paring.

Name: Enza Famiglia Trattoria
Description: This tiny trattoria just a step from Le Louvre is not empty, and for good reason! At its head, Enza Sicilian origin that gives you a smile with great antipasto, fresh homemade pasta and gourmet desserts. Freshness, quality (all meats are of French origin), but above all simplicity and good humor, this is the recipe for their success. The slate changes regularly and every day the chef displays his specialties. For example spaghetti bolognese, Italian sausage and polenta, chocolate salami. Let's say it: the whole panoply of Italian cuisine is within our reach thanks to a considerable choice. "the smart little 2019"

Name: Le Madeleine C
Description: Le Madeleine C restaurant in Paris is just a few paces from the iconic Place de la Madeleine and the great temples of shopping, but on a quiet side street which makes it a convenient stop and a welcome haven. The kitchen is managed by a "Maître Restaurateur", which combines texture flavor and color on seasonal products. The smart dining room with its wooden floors, white table linens, ochre and rust colours, comfortable booths and banquettes has a relaxed, informal ambience. The menu features French bourgeois cuisine presented in beautifully modern style, dishes like terrine of seared foie gras, fresh oysters, crispy Bar, and creme brulee. The flavours are refined, the service helpful and friendly, and the experience very pleasant indeed.

Name: Le Seraphin
Description: Séraphin in Paris' 6th district in the well know quarter of Saint Germain de Près, sets out to recreate the atmosphere of an old fashioned delicatessen. The food represents France's past and future, mixing old recipes with modern ideas. Try the carrot and cumin mousse followed by a tuna steak flavoured with sesame and accompanied by tagliatelle and courgettes. Unlike the food the décor and atmosphere is resolutely old fashioned. Wooden furnishing and old objects from delicatessens are scattered throughout. Huge bay windows make the restaurant light and pleasant.

Name: Le First
Description: Facing the Tuileries Gardens, le First, restaurant boudoir paris invites you to taste an authentic and inventive cuisine, in an elegant setting designed by Jacques Garcia. The chef, David Real, also offers new meals every day to reinvent its two lunch menus permanently. From October to June, le First propose you it's famous brunch every sundays from 12.15am to 3pm. We will be pleased to let you discover our "Sprunch" offer, including a care in our spa and the brunch.

Name: La Plume
Description: An ode to the discovery and travel, the restaurant “La Plume Rive Droite” offers a Japanese culinary experience combining French flavors. Open into an indoor patio and nestled above the zinc roofs, the panoramic restaurant offers a breathtaking view over an unseen Paris.

Name: Freddy's
Description: @ Freddy’s no réservations are taken, only love @ Freddy’s on prend pas des réservations, que d’amour

Name: Lyna Ristorante
Description: A bit of Italy in the city of lights... Place to the delight of taste buds with this beautiful gourmet address. In an atmosphere of hushed, intimate tables carefully set up, the invitation to the culinary journey is made with the inevitable team Lyna and his Neapolitan chef Enzo what more...

Name: La Cuisine
Description: La Cuisine restaurant welcomes you for an outstanding Sunday brunch with a table service offering a multitude of flavours. The Brunch of the most Parisian of the Palaces is transformed and enriched with a table service. Every Sunday, creative dishes are proposed by our Chefs who will enliven the room with live shows from our open kitchen throughout the brunch. As for our team, they will bring you your à la carte selection in order to share a warm and friendly moment at your table.

Name: Le Pavillon de la Grande Cascade
Description: La Grande Cascade is a gourmet restaurant located in the heart of the Bois de Boulogne. For a romantic dinner in winter or an alfresco lunch on a sunny day in summer, La Grande Cascade is the perfect rendezvous for anyone who loves fine dining and beautiful scenery in Paris. Yet La Grande Cascade has not always been a restaurant, and this explains its unusual and truly exceptional decor. It was originally a lodge where Napoleon III, who came to the Bois de Boulogne to hunt, could take a rest. Over the years, La Grande Cascade has changed with the times while maintaining its unique "retro-modern" style. Inside, the gilding, chandeliers and mirrors offer a distinct charm to a residence that has retained its period magnificence.

Name: Palais du Bonheur
Description: Traditional Chinese restaurant with Home Made dim sum and the famous Beijing duck in 4 styles . All our food are prepared by our Singapore experienced cook Mr Shee and his team . He worked for about 40 years in chinese cooking . We have a private room of 25 seats for special businesses and family events . We can do also special orders as well .

Name: Le V
Description: Le restaurant le V welcomes you under the amazing Gustave Eiffel's glassroof in a cosy and warm atmosphere. The talented and creative Chef, Richard Robe, will make you enjoy Parisian Cuisine working simply noble products and nobly simple products.

Name: Le Paprika Restaurant
Description: THE one and only hungarian restaurant in Paris! We propose hungarian specialties but also a nice french menu.

Name: Cepe & Figue
Description: French cuisine : Beef bourguignon, Frog legs, Onion soup, Snails.A large selection of wines (most can be ordered by the glass) is available to accompany your meal.You can also experience the flavors of "Kusmi Teas", while indulging one of our many homemade pastries.Lunch menu at 12€, dinner menu at 19€

Name: Lucas Carton
Description: Senderens restaurant in Paris with stunning views toward the church of the Madeleine (Da Vinci Code fans take note) is one of the city���s most important restaurants, replete with history and full of exciting modernity. Originally opened in 1890, taken over and redecorated in true Art Deco style in the 1920���s, it operated as three-star Lucas Carton until 2005 when chef Alain Senderens gave back the stars, changed the name and transformed the d��cor and menu to create this stylish, informal restaurant. The beautiful Art Deco carvings remain, but now the tables are free of starchy linens, the service is relaxed and the dishes are innovative and exotic. Veal tartare with langoustines and rice noodles is stunning, as is the Racan pigeon stuffed with crab meat and poached in Qi Lan tea. The cellar remains a high-end experience. For elegant, sleek, exciting dining in the heart of town, Senderens will delight you.

Name: Prik Thai
Description: PRIK THAÏ, thaï restaurant in Paris 9eme.(4 rue de la Tour d'Auvergne | metro : "Anvers", or "Cadet", or "Poissonnière"You'll like this really tasty thaï food. Every dish is full of flavours, and ou specialities are all cooked with subtils aroms of galanga, gingember, canelle or limongrass.All dishes are prepared freshly, and our menus start from 8.00€ to 14.00€.The thaï Chief, Satja Plidrok, was born in Phuket, and his thaï spécialities taste the real and traditionnal popular thaï cook. Pad Thaï, chicken with lemongras sauce, porc with caramel sauce, green papaye salads, sweet custard with coco milk, you'll enjoy this oriental meal in the heart of Paris.

Name: FOODI Jia-Ba-Buay
Description: FOODI Jia-Ba-Buay is an Asia cooking school and Taiwaneses restaurant. We serve lunch from Monday to Sunday (12h-14h30).Dinner from Thursday to Saturday night .For the restaurant, we have differents Bento(lunch box with Japanese style), home made dumplings and tasty taiwanese GaoBao. We change the menu every month. Our recipes are original classic. Freshe ingredients, healthy and no doubt delicious! Reservation recommended. Hope to see you soon.

Name: Au Petit Marguery
Description: Le Petit Marguery restaurant in Paris' Port-Royal quarter has the soul of a traditional French neighbourhood restaurant of a century ago. The mirrors and columns, fresh flowers, the layers of white table linen, the long-aproned waiters in their waistcoats and bow ties, the dark rose colour scheme create a cosy, comfortable and quite smart milieu.

Name: La Cochonnaille
Description: Since 1965, La Cochonnaille has offered traditional French cuisine. Generous and good dishes to please the taste buds and the eyes.

Name: Sixtine
Description: Enjoy french cuisine and relaxing ambiance at Sixtine. Our stylish restaurant located in the Paris Marriott Opera Ambassador Hotel offers a fine dining, bar onsite and craft cocktails.

Name: Connetable Le
Description: To drink, squire! With such a name (the constable was a count charge of the royal stables) is expected to find a medieval tavern in the heart of the Marais. And indeed, it is not so far: this mansion of Cardinal de Retz is a living character with exposed beams, HQ night owls of all ages. During the day, the Constable shows a different face: that of a chic restaurant Marais. First we do not walk on it, the atmosphere is cozy, the older crowd and the room upstairs is open. In true French culinary tradition, the menu offers meat and fish sauce well (such as sliced ​​turkey with porcini mushrooms) generously accompanied by fried potatoes with garlic and good structured wine. Here we love local products quality and taste rather than dietetics is favored. The addition is a bit salty, but still reasonable for the area. At 20h-21h most days, small groups of French song there discover other bars referenced by Time Out Paris click see the full list of the 100 best bars selected by Time Out Paris cl

Name: Cafe Louise St Germain Des Prés
Au Bistrot de la Montagne - Paris restaurant for groups
Description: Restaurant for groups in Paris (only group) In the historical Paris Latin Quarter, the restaurant Au Bistrot de la Montagne is at the confluence of Notre- Dame, the Sorbonne and the Pantheon. In a medieval setting of the 13th century (apparent stonework and wooden beams), this warm restaurant, welcomes you for a business meal, a birthday, or any group meal you want with your friends and family, from ten to 200 people. The cuisine is classic and traditional ( coq au vin, duck confit, boeuf bourguignon, etc ) , as is the wine list. The service is very professional, discreet and friendly. And for pleasure, group's dinner with entertainment and drinks included.

Name: L'Ete en Pente Douce
Description: Away from the crowds on a classic neighborhood corner, offers fine indoor and outdoor seating, €10 plats du jour and €13 salads, veggie options, and good wines (daily, hike from Sacré-Coeur basilica away from tourist zone and down the stairs)

Name: Higuma
Description: This is the ramen restaurant where serve not only ramen, but also the popular Japanese dishes for example, Tendon, Gyudon , Katsudon, Yakisoba and Nikuyasai etc... Moreover we offer the small dishes too.

Name: Tesoro D'Italia
Description: Dishes with colors of Italy, warm and full of saveurs.Un journey to the heart of this country for a price even cheaper than Easyjet ticket.

Name: Finzi Restaurant & Traiteur Italien
Description: Between Saint-Philippe du Roule and the Place de l'Etoile, near the Champs Elysées, this Italian Jewel is somewhat unexpected in this business district. Yet families, friends and couples gather here to feast on authentic Northern Italian cuisine. Copious dishes, always respecting the freshest seasonal products, are served in a friendly courteous manner.

Name: Restaurant de La Maison de L'Amérique Latine
cafe Roussillon
Description: Cafe on corner of Rue Cler. Very popular with locals and tourists. Free wi-fi. Great place for breakfast.

Name: Lorette
Description: On the menu, no fake but essential dishes, authentic and tasty French cuisine. Old-fashioned mayo eggs, string salmon with brioche bread or crispy chicken salad, followed by sausage puree, steak or fillet of bar accompanied by chorizo ​​black rice. And finally be tempted by the profiteroles sprinkled with hot chocolate instead or the already famous French toast.

Name: Maison De La Truffe
Description: Maison de la Truffe sublimates the Black Diamond of French Gastronomy since 1932. Two parisian places, offering a boutique and a restaurant, and a corner in Courchevel, to discover the subleties of the Truffle, in all its form. Designed by the spanish decorator Thomas Urquijo in a modern Art Déco style, elegant and graphic, this second restaurant is located near the Champagne Elysées and welcomes you in the warm atmosphere of a luxury Brasserie.

Name: Les Pipos
Description: Les Pipos is a journey back to real Parisian bistro culture. With a clientele composed of regulars, tourists, students from the Sorbonne and administrative workers from the French ministries across the street, there is always a convivial environment and interesting conversations going on at all times of the day. You can have a traditional french meal inspired from Auvergene, Normandy and the South of France at any time until 11pm on weekdays and 11h30pm on weekends. Les Pipos has a diverse and particular wine list for all tastes. We work with wine producers who are invested in exposing the simplicity and exquisite nature of french wines, many of which are organic (no sulfur). The owner prides himself in serving fresh produce, so makes all his purchases in Rungis (the largest fresh produce market near Paris) and has nothing delivered. All cuts of meat, fish and vegetables are hand-picked by the owner himself. There is live music every Friday and Saturday. It is best to reserve on the weekends to guarantee a table. Payments can be made by cash or credit cards (visa,mastercard, debit) but we do not accept American Express however.

Name: Djakarta Bali
Description: Near the Louvre museum, the Indonesian and Balinese restaurant Djakarta Bali welcomes you in the heart of Paris, 1st district at "Les Halles" area. Our restaurant makes you travel accross the regional specialities of Indonesia, from Java to Sumatra island... Enjoy your meal in a elegant and ethnical atmosphere, with the sound of traditional gamelan instrument music and zen ambiance, every friday night balinese danse show.

Name: Cafe Le Petit Pont
Description: Situated in one of the hottest areas of Paris, in the 5th arrondissement opposite the iconic Notre Dame and close to the Saint Michel metro station is the brasserie restaurant Le Petit Pont. Enjoying an incredibly privileged position, the restaurant is open for breakfast from 8am until 11.30am serving poached eggs, various cold meats, cheese, seasonal fruits and pastries. Lunchtimes and evenings offers a choice of two menu styles- Italian and French, the latter including the most delicious meat from Auvergne. The soothing sounds from the piano create an intimate atmosphere and the special cocktails prepared by the barman are just divine.

Name: Gosier
Description:
Gosier offers plates to share. Sharing is Gosier's raison d'être. After a long career in the automotive industry, Jean-Michel wanted to let his guests enjoy his innate sense of hospitality by delighting them with beautiful dishes and fine wines. His wife, Sandrine, later joined him in this adventure and continues to welcome guests from all over the world today.

Chef Raul has been leading the kitchen for two years. He creates a new menu every two weeks, which is creative, seasonal, and inspired by his extensive international experiences. The cuisine is gourmet and refined, featuring surprising pairings, with everything made in-house.

A selective wine list accompanies the plates and also promises delightful discoveries.

Name: Aux Prés
Description: 27, rue du Dragon: a cult address in the Saint Germain des Prés quarter. One that has played host to many of the world’s ‘beautiful people’ since it first opened in the 1950s: actors, singers, politicians and even some of the international élite. “Le Tout Paris” has graced the upholstered wall seats of the “Claude Sainlouis”. When, in 2011, the opportunity arose to stage a much admired come-back for this one-time king of bistros on the capital’s left bank, Cyril Lignac needed no second asking. Keenly aware of the venue’s history and spirit, the master chef restored the prestige and status of this Latin Quarter institution while carefully preserving the warm atmosphere and authenticity. Renamed “Aux Prés”, this cult Bistro serves typically Bistro-style cuisine with flavours from around the world. Uplifting cuisine inspired by the Chef’s travels and encounters. With, more than ever, pride of place given to French and foreign home produce.

Name: L'Italien
Description: METRO ST-PHILIPPE DU ROULE - In the district Paris 8 - Champs-Elysées, Italian is a godsend. The reason: an excellent price vs quality and a comfortable space. ITALIAN AFFORDABLE - The food is copious (antipasto, pizza, veal cutlet Milanese, penne arrabiata with ...) and as it is a market fresh cooked products, we never tire. Current quality products direct from Italy. Welcom to L'Italien

Name: Alix et Mika - Tartares sur mesure
Le Saint Severin
Description: NOTE : PLEASE Do not confuse with other restaurants that have almost the same name, The name of our restaurant is " LE SAINT SEVERIN "it's located at number 5 Saint Severin Street , 75005 , Paris , In front of the church the saint Séverin . so we are not concerned by the bad ratings left by the Net surfers. Restaurant Le Saint Séverin is located in the heart of the 5th arrondissement (Paris 75005) In front of the church the saint Séverin , and offers traditional French cuisine. The restaurant also offers seafood platters. All privatization requests must be made at least 48 hours in advance. We will be delighted to welcome you every day from 11:30 to 23:30 to enjoy our dishes and specialties.

Name: Le Bouledogue Restaurant Cafe & Brasserie
Description: Le Bouledogue Brasserie ( Le Marais, Paris ) • if you want to experience amazing french cuisine while you remain local and away from the touristic cliches, then Le Bouledogue is one of my top recommendations. Right at the beginning of Le Marais and only meters away from the Centre Pompidou.
